result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason F Jones

records.addlTxt:
1:42 PM Defendant Jason F Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Sean P Riordan and Attorney Erin Preston in court for Jason F Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a plea and sentencing

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 22CF498
Plea - Ct. 1: GUILTY
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Cts. 2 thru 33 are dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 6 years Wisconsin State Prison; 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision; imposed and stayed for 24 months probation:

Conditions of Probation:
180 days Racine County Jail; STAYED
Absolute sobriety;
No contact with the victims in any of the cases;
Restitution ordered in the amount of $300 in case 20CM511;
Comply with Drug Treatment Court;
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge.

BTC: Cases 22CM28 and 20CM511 are dismissed but read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
